noun.description: A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, nonretractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
A person regarded as unpleasant, contemptible, or wicked (used as a term of abuse)

examples: if only I could sit down and rest my tired dogs

verb.description: Follow (someone or their movements) closely and persistently.
examples: photographers seemed to dog her every step

verb.description: Act lazily; fail to try one's hardest.

examples: she has dogged the door shut

phrases: in this business, it's always dog eat dog
popular music is a dog-eat-dog industry
Labor was effective when it employed direct action against the capitalists, posed a principled and inspirational solidarity movement against the dog eat dog values of the obscenely rich.
It's a dog eat dog world out there and the young need the best qualifications they can get.
It was a dog eat dog world, where everything was a competition.
origin: Old English docga, of unknown origin.
